page.title: 02Hersden, Nr. Wickhambreaux.
page.content: { { Hersden}is a mining village on the main A28 road from{Canterbury}to {Ramsgate.}Along the main road there are a few shops, a newsagent, a fish and chip shop and a garage. There is also a police house. The houses in {Hersden}are all very similar, except for the police house and another house which we thought was the chief miner's house. On the south side of the main road are{slag heaps.}Around this area we found lots of wildlife like rabbits, ladybirds, ants and grasshoppers; there were masses of wild flowers. The mine closed down in 1968-69 because it was uneconomic. The mine has left some old fossils and strata samples. The railway runs just below the old mine and beyond that is{Stodmarsh Nature {Reserve.
